question: Which is the only country in the world that forms habitat to the "Corsican nuthatch"?
explanation: Corsican nuthatch is a small bird that is found only in and endemic to the Corsican Island, one of the 18 regions of France. It is a passerine bird species. Its habitat is restricted to the mature stands of Corsican Pine. According to the IUCN's Red List of Threatened Species, it is a "vulnerable" bird species. It is facing major threats such as habitat destruction due to fire and predation by great spotted woodpeckers.
